content.raw:
> I thought some sort of integration with ign-transport would give a more useful use-case

Oh yes, sorry, I think the intention of the plugin wasn't clear. `CommandActor` is not meant to be used, it's supposed to demonstrate how a downstream plugin could use the C++ API to control an actor. That's why it's under `examples/plugin` instead of `src/systems` and it isn't installed. I just tried to create an example which would clearly show how to use the API and its the resulting effect. My plan is to extend this demo to other types of actor control later, like setting bone poses directly, setting the animation time, etc.

I agree that a transport interface would eventually be handy though.

> tags that don’t exist in the spec

Oh sorry yeah those tags were meant to be used only in the context of this demo.
